answers.answer: What is his blood sugar like at 2am, 4am and when he wakes up? Do you test him during the night to make sure he's not fighting a low or high that's robbing him of sleep? I get sleepy when I am low (in the 50s) and as soon as I am higher than 170. As long as his blood sugars are managed well, he does not need more sleep than other kids his age.Nicki

Yes, I test him several times during the night and his sugars are usually great in the morning. I guess he's not a morning person. I just wanted to double check to see if the diabetes had anything to do with it. Thanks.

question: My 6 year old has a difficult time getting up and getting ready for school in the morning. He is also a Type 1 diabetic. Does one thing have anything to do with the other?
title: Do diabetic children need more sleep?
